lines.gurmukhi: siqgur isK irdY pRQm kiRpw kY bsY qw pwCY krq AwigAw mieAw kY mnwveI
lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Sikh Ridai Pradam Kripaa Kai Basai , Taa Paachhai Karat Aagiaa Maiaa Kai Manaavaee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The True Guru becomes clement and enters the heart of a Sikh first. Then he asks the Sikh to meditate on Naam and showers his kindness to make him meditate.

lines.gurmukhi: AwigAw mwin igAwn gur prm inDwn dwn gurmuiK suiK Pl inj pd pwveI
lines.transliteration_english: Aagiaa Maani Giaan Gur Param Nidhaan Daana , Gurmukhi Soukhi Dhal Nij Pad Paavaee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Obeying the command of the True Guru, a Guru-conscious person indulges in Naam Simran- a supreme treasure of the Lord and enjoys the spiritual comfort. He also attains the ultimate spiritual state.

lines.gurmukhi: nwm inhkwm Dwm shj smwiD ilv Agm AgwiD kQw khq n AwveI
lines.transliteration_english: Naam Nihakaam Dhaam Sahaj Samaadhi Liva , Agam Agaadhi Kadaa Kahat N Aavaee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: In that spiritual realm, he achieves that high state of Naam where all desires of reward or fruit vanish. Thus he gets engrossed in a deep concentration. This state is beyond description.

lines.gurmukhi: jYso jYso Bwau kir pUjq pdwribMd skl sMswr kY mnorQ pujwveI ]178]
lines.transliteration_english: Jaiso Jaiso Bhaau Kari Poojat Padaarabinda , Sakal Sansaar Kai Manorad Pujaavaee ?178?

Shabad OS B.translation: With whatever desires and sentiments one worships the True Guru, He fulfils all his wants and desires. (178)
